c74object.name: mvc.send
c74object.digest: Simple sender to mvc.parameter, mvc.state and mvc.message.
c74object.description: mvc.send allows to send data to a component's input for remote control. This can either be a mvc.parameter, an mvc.state or an mvc.message. The address should be stated as an OSC string. The mvc.send does not support braces and wildcard notation; you should use mvc.remote for that.

inlet.digest: Messages to set the values (see below)

objarg.name: address
objarg.description: The address of the monitored mvc.parameter, mvc.state or mvc.message should be expressed with slash-separated symbols (Ã la OSC).

method.name: anything (on the left inlet)
method.digest: Feed values to mvc.send (on the left inlet).
method.description: The values fed to the left inlet will be sent to the corresponding address in the namespace, provided a matching mvc.parameter, mvc.state or mvc.message address exists.

method.name: address (on the right inlet)
method.digest: Sets the address value of the mvc.parameter, mvc.state or mvc.message to monitor.
method.description:
address is a possible method on the right inlet.
The address of a specific mvc.parameter, mvc.state or mvc.message can be given as an OSC formatted symbol. Brace expansion notation and wildcards are not supported by mvc.send .
